result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hector W. Gago

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

[MK] cases #22CF318, #22CM104 called at 11:11am 
Defendant Hector W. Gago in court with Attorney Francis Raff.  ADA Michael Witt in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
In response to the Court's inquiry whether it is still fine to conduct the proceedings in English, Attorney Raff indicates that it is. 
Attorney Raff notes the trial date scheduled, and indicates that the Court should keep the trial on. 

Attorney Raff raises that Mr. Gago does not qualify for the Public Defender because he is employed; the contract upon which he was appointed as counsel has been concluded. Attorney Raff indicates that he will accept an appointment if the Court directly appoints him. 
The Court directs Attorney Raff to go to the Clerk of Courts Office and seek the special county appointment.  The Court directs Attorney Raff to go to the Clerk of Courts Office to check in with the clerk to make sure that is approved by that office 
ADA Witt confirms that the State is prepared to proceed to trial [case #22CM104]. 
recess 11:16am 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference tomorrow at at 10:00am, (2) JA- schedule case 22CF318 for Status Conference on December 8th at 2:00pm,  (3) in case #22CM104 the December 8th FSSC and the December 14th Jury Trial remain on the Court's calendar
Status conference on November 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
[MK] cases #22CF318 and #22CM104 called at 8:44am 
Defendant Hector W. Gago in court with Attorney Francis Raff.  ADA  Krysta Parson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Shawna Stevenoski is sworn as Spanish Interpreter.   However Attorney Raff indicates that Mr. Gago has told him that he does not need an interpreter, and that he is finding that hearing the English and Spanish simultaneously is confusing.  
After making inquiries of Mr. Gago and having Mr. Gago begin to read the prelim-waiver form, the Court excuses the interpreter for the reminder of the hearing. 

In Case #22CF318 Prelim-Waiver and Arraignment are held: 
---Mr. Gago waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
---service of Information admitted, reading waived; the charged and maximum penalties are recited
---pleas of "not guilty" are entered
---in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess 8:56am  

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference is to be held informally,  (2) Status Conference on November 1st at 11:00am,  (3) as to case #22CM104 only- the December 8th FSSC and the December 14th Jury Trial remain on the Court's calendar

Francis P Raff

*Nunc Pro Tunc to 8/17/2022 to coincide with order appt. under contract in 22CM104.*

ec: DA and Atty Raff (9/6/22--ma)
Per 8/23/22 Minutes - the Court appoints Attorney Raff to both cases--appointment in  22CM104 is to extend to 22CF318.
Preliminary hearing on September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ma] Cases 22CF318 & 22CM104 called at 3:35 PM 
Defendant Hector W. Gago in court.  Attorney Michael Witt in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Francis Raff appears for Hector Gago in Case 22CM104.
Shawna Stevenoski sworn as Spanish Interpreter

The Court reviews court records regarding appointment of counsel and case in which petition was submitted. 

Upon agreement of both Mr. Gago and Attorney Raff, the Court appoints Attorney Raff to both cases--appointment in  22CM104 is to extend to 22CF318. 

ADA Witt provides copy of criminal complaint in Case 22CF318 to Defense. 

Initial Appearance occurs in Case 22CF318:
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint 

Bond is maintained. 
recess: 3:42pm  

NEXT:   As to Case 22CF318, Preliminary Hearing on 9/23/22 at 8:30am 
As to Case 22CM104, Status on 9/23/22 at 8:30am
Initial appearance on August 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.

[ml] Cases 22CM104 and 22CM105 called at 2:27PM
Defendant Hector Gago appears without counsel. Defendant Maureen Stark appears in court with attorney Karl Huebner. ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Spanish Interpreter Liesl Monroy sworn in.

As to file 22CM105:
Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered as to Counts #2 and #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance is verified.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #4.

On Counts #2 and #3, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with any conditions as required by the Probation agent, and that the Defendant pay all costs, fees, and surcharges, to be collected by the DOC.

The Court orders the Defendant to comply with the DNA sample provision requirement.

The court sets restitution in this file at $0.00.

Days credit for time already served: 0 days

The Court orders the Defendant to appear at the Jefferson County Probation Office no later than 12:00 noon on 08/16/2022.

--------------------------------

As to file 22CM104:

The State advises that an offer has not been extended as the Defendant asserts that he wants a trial in this matter.
The Defendant advises that he wishes to proceed with a trial as scheduled in December.
The Court reviews the waiver of counsel with the Defendant, and his right to counsel.
The Court finds that the Defendant is competent to represent himself at the trial in December.

recess 2:47PM

------------------------------

reconvene 2:47PM

The State requests that the Court go back on the record so that a hearing can be conducted in file 22CF318.

As to file 22CF318:
Mr. Gago confirms that he received a copy of the Criminal Complaint.
The Court declines to proceed with a full Initial Appearance, and sets bond.
The Court recites Right to Counsel, and the Defendant advises that he will apply for the Public Defender's Office services. The Court requires the Defendant to call the Public Defender's Office no later than 4:00PM today. Furthermore, the Court directs the Defendant to appear before Rm 115 to acquire, complete, and submit a Petition for a Court Appointed Attorney.

The Court requires a $2,500.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
--report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs) today

The Court removes the 08/22 Initial Appearance from the Commissioner's calendar.

recess 2:55PM

NEXT: 
In file 22CF318:
(1) Initial Appearance on 08/23 at 3:00PM (other file to track along for Status) 
(2) The December Jury Trial dates remain on the Court's calendar as to file 22CM104
